intro: Cacalia spathulata, commonly known as the broadleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, giving it a distinctive appearance. Cacalia spathulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive blooms and hardy nature.
